reviews.review_msg: Great prof. He was a bit intimidating at first, but he's a good guy. Very strong knowledge on joint ventures and IB in general.
He was so approachable and sweet
Sincerely nice guy and hard working prof.

Best class i've ever had with a teacher who is too good for the institution if I could be honest, this guy belongs to a top Ivy leauge school. I feel lucky that I got to have a class with this professor!
The best IB professor in SFU, course structure is very clear, no need to read the textbook. nice person, give quick response for in-class questions

Her class was well structured and was graded fairly with your work.  I have been working in a venture listed company for 2 years and my job is to deal with international JV.  I have benefited greatly from her "KSF" framework to figure out a solution for real business deals.

Course requires a lot of praticipation, case studies, presenations (like all of it!), and group work. Li responds quickly and throughly to questions. The marking scheme was challening to figure out, so I figured out things as I went along. It would have been better to get clarification at the beginning, rather than after the marks are back.
